title: What should we do with BIG DATA?
text:
Frictionless reproducibility



data sharing, code sharing, and benchmark data competition

FR1: Data sharing
FR2: Code sharing
FR3: The common task framework
Example: Empirical machine learning

Rapid and accelerating progress since ~2012
Data: Imagenet, Common Crawl, etc.
Code:

Scientific Python ecosystem
Theano, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Hugging face, etc.

Common tasks: Imagenet, Kaggle, etc.

Another example: COVID mRNA vaccines

Data: COVID19 sequence available









David Donoho







‚ÄúData Science at the Singularity‚Äù, 2024

title: What should we do with BIG DATA?
text:
Challenges of BIG DATA

Research procedures that are routine for small experimental datasets are close to impossible in large datasets
These datasets present remarkable opportunities to harness data-driven methods, such as machine learning algorithms, to study the brain basis of individual differences, but care needs to be taken so that these methods are not led astray by confounding information or become too opaque to provide useful information.
We have addressed this by creating tightly-matched sub-samples from large datasets, and by harnessing interpretable machine learning methods.
